##ARRAY
```{r}
# creates a two-dimensional array containing numbers from 1 to 24 that have 3 rows and 4 columns
array_dta <- array(c(1:24), c(3,4,2))
array_dta

# checking for the dimensions
# row, column, dimension
dim(array_dta)

#checking for the number of elements
length(array_dta)

vectorA <- c(1:24)

# creating an array
an_Array <- array(vectorA, dim = c(3,4,2))
an_Array
```


##3.ARRAY
```{r}
##a)
#Original values
values <- c(1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0, 3, 4, 5, 1)

#Repeat twice
values_repeated <- rep(values, 2)

#Create 3D array with 2 rows, 4 columns
my_array <- array(values_repeated, dim = c(2, 4, 3))
print(my_array)



##b)
dim(my_array)
length(dim(my_array))
#b. It has 3 dimensions



##c)
rownames <- c("a", "b")
colnames <- c("A", "B", "C", "D")
dimnames_list <- list(rownames, colnames, c("1st-Dimensional Array", "2nd-Dimensional Array", "3rd-Dimensional Array"))



#Assigning dimnames to the array
dimnames(my_array) <- dimnames_list
print(my_array)
```
